Solflare Shield is designed for real-world crypto use: mobile, instant, and fully non-custodial.

TL;DR from this Solflare Shield üßµ

‚Ä¢ Your funds live on chain, not on the Shield
‚Ä¢ Your Shield protects the keys that control those funds
‚Ä¢ Losing the card is ok if you have your recovery phrase
‚Ä¢ Never share your recovery phrase with anyone
‚Ä¢ Solflare never stores your PIN

12. What you get in the box

‚Ä¢ Solflare Hardware Wallet Card
‚Ä¢ Instruction card with app QR
‚Ä¢ Seed phrase recovery sheet
‚Ä¢ Tamper evident packaging

11. Why does this security model work?

The card cannot be hacked remotely.
It has no network access.

NFC only activates during a physical tap and only completes when the PIN or biometrics verify the action.

Even if someone steals your phone or installs malware, they still

10. Simple recovery

What if I lose my shield?
Restore with the recovery phrase.

Shield destroyed?
Restore with the recovery phrase.

Forgot PIN but still have the card?
Erase and restore with the recovery phrase.

Forgot both PIN and recovery phrase?
No one can recover the

9. Managing Shield

You can update your PIN, enable or disable biometrics, erase the card, or remove it from the app, all inside wallet management.

Erasing wipes everything and resets to factory state, so use it only when the recovery phrase is safely backed up.

Removing your

8. What about signing transactions?

‚Üí Start a transaction in the Solflare app.
‚Üí Confirm with PIN or biometrics.
‚Üí Tap the card to your phone.
‚Üí The transaction is signed securely and broadcasted.

No tap means no signing.
No physical card means no authorization.

Phone

7. How setup works?

‚Üí Open Solflare.
‚Üí Select Solflare Hardware Wallet.
‚Üí Scan the card.
‚Üí Create a new wallet or import one.
‚Üí Back up the phrase.
‚Üí Set a PIN.
‚Üí Tap again to confirm and optionally turn on biometrics.

Done. Created in under two minutes.

Note: Even if

6. PIN, biometrics, and security

PIN authorizes all signing.
Solflare app passcode only unlocks the app.
They are separate.

Biometrics simply unlock the PIN stored on that one phone. They are not stored on Shield. If you change phones, you re-enable them.

Three incorrect PIN https://t.co/6D6MFnC8rQ

5. What actually lives on the card?

Only two things.

‚Ä¢ Your recovery phrase
‚Ä¢ Your PIN

Nothing else.
No identity data. No balances. No logs.
No connection records.

During setup, the phrase appears on your phone screen only one time, so you need to back it up securely.

It

4. What happens if the card is lost?

Your funds remain safe.
They live on chain, not on your Shield.

You simply restore access with your 12-word recovery phrase on a new Shield.

The card protects the keys.
The blockchain holds the assets.

3. What blockchains does it support?

At launch, it supports Solana only, providing exactly what you need for a dedicated, ultra-seamless Solana experience.

2. How does it differ from other hardware wallets?

You get a better safety model with a completely different experience.

‚Ä¢ A thin card instead of a gadget
‚Ä¢ NFC tap to sign instead of cables and screens
‚Ä¢ No firmware updates or charging
‚Ä¢ Designed entirely for your Solflare https://t.co/yizV3zeRTw

1. What exactly is Solflare Shield?

It's a credit card-sized hardware wallet.

Your private keys are created and stored inside a secure element chip that never goes online.

No batteries. No plugs or wires. No Bluetooth.
You tap it to your phone to sign, and that is it. https://t.co/cHW10l4jw4

data.text:
When you understand self-custody,
mistakes start feeling like lessons.

You don‚Äôt need to delete your wallet.
You just need to know you‚Äôre in control.

Download Solflare:
https://t.co/KxPfUQ46kB

If you suspect your seed phrase words got compromised, the safest move is simple:

‚Üí Create a new wallet with a new recovery phrase
‚Üí Move your assets there

Once empty and unused, the old address becomes dormant.

It still exists on-chain, but only you can access it again.

Why can't you delete a wallet from the blockchain?

It‚Äôs a permanent part of the Solana ledger, like a page in a book that can‚Äôt be erased.

If you want to stop using a specific address:
‚Üí Transfer your assets to a new address
‚Üí Remove that address from your Solflare app
‚Üí https://t.co/FJ609qA60o

This is a question we often see in support.

Sometimes, after a mistake, following a loss, or just to start fresh.

A self-custodial wallet exists fully on-chain.

Solflare is the secure bridge that lets you access it without ever storing or copying your data. https://t.co/CWBphRPfxG

Can you delete a Solflare wallet from the Solana blockchain!? ‚Üë

Short answer ‚Üí no.

But the reason why is exactly what makes self-custody powerful. ‚Üì https://t.co/swYo00056A
